ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.2_0: At that time a number of monks who were friends had entered the rainy-season residence on the banks of the river Vaggumudā.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.3_0: Just then Vajjī was short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.4_0: and it was not easy to get by on almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.5_0: The monks considered the difficult circumstances, and they thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.6_0: “How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rainy season,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.7_0: and have no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.10_0: and they’ll give something in return.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.11_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.12_0: and have no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.14_0: “Enough, Reverend, what’s the point of working for householders?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.15_0: Let’s instead take messages for them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.16_0: and they’ll give something in return.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.17_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.18_0: and have no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.20_0: “Enough, Reverend, what’s the point of working for householders?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.21_0: nor to take messages for them.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.22_0: Let’s instead praise one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.23_0: ‘Such a monk has the first absorption,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.24_0: such a monk the second absorption,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.31_0: such a monk has the three true insights,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.32_0: and such the six direct knowledges.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.33_0: and they’ll give something in return.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.34_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.35_0: and have no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.36_0: Indeed, this is the better way, that we praise one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.37_0: Then those monks praised one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.38_0: “Such a monk has the first absorption ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.39_0: such a monk has the six direct knowledges.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.41_0: “We’re fortunate that such monks have come to us for the rainy-season residence.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.42_0: Such monks as these, who are virtuous and of good character, have never before entered the rains residence with us.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.43_0: And they gave such food and drink to those monks that they did not even eat and drink themselves, or give to their parents, to their wives and children, to their slaves, servants, and workers, to their friends and companions, or to their relatives.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.44_0: And they gave such food and drink to those monks that they did not even eat and drink themselves, or give to their parents, to their wives and children, to their slaves, servants, and workers, to their friends and companions, or to their relatives.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.45_0: In this way those monks were satisfied, with a good color, a bright face, and clear skin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.1_0: It’s been a long time to go to see the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.2_0: So when they had competed the rains residence and the three months had elapsed, those monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and left for Vesālī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.3_0: When they eventually arrived, they went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.3_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.4_0: At that time the monks who had completed the rains residence in that region were thin, haggard and pale, their veins protruding all over their limbs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.5_0: But the monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā were satisfied, with a good color, a bright face, and clear skin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.6_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.8_0: “I hope you are keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.9_0: I hope you had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and that you had no trouble getting almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.10_0: “I can bear up, Fortunate One, I can carry on, Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.11_0: we had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.12_0: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not; they know the right time to ask and the right time not to ask. Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, not when it is unbeneficial, for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.13_0: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.15_0: “In what way, monks, did you have a comfortable rains residence, without having any trouble getting almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.17_0: “But had you really achieved those superhuman qualities?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.20_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.21_0: How can you for the sake of your stomachs praise one another’s superhuman qualities to householders?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.22_0: It would be better for your bellies to be cut open with a sharp butcher’s knife than for you to praise one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.24_0: Because for that reason you might die or experience death-like suffering,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.25_0: but you wouldn’t because of that be reborn in a bad destination.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.27_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.28_0: after criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.1_0: “Monks, there are these five great gangsters to be found in the world.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.3_0: A great gangster thinks like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.4_0: ‘Oh when will I, with a following of a hundred or a thousand men, wander among villages, towns, and royal capitals,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.5_0: killing and making others kill, destroying and making others destroy, tormenting and making others torment?’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.6_0: Then after some time, he does just that.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.7_0: Just so, monks, a bad monk thinks like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.8_0: ‘Oh when will I, with a following of a hundred or a thousand people, go wandering among villages, towns, and royal capitals;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.9_0: be honored, respected, and revered by both lay people and those gone forth; and obtain robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicines?’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.10_0: Then after some time, he does just that.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.11_0: This is the first great gangster to be found in the world.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.12_0: Again, a bad monk learns the spiritual path proclaimed by the Buddha and takes it as his own.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.13_0: This is the second great gangster to be found in the world.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.14_0: Again, a bad monk groundlessly charges someone who lives the spiritual life in purity with not abstaining from sexuality.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.15_0: This is the third great gangster to be found in the world.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.16_0: Furthermore, a bad monk gives out of respect for the Sangha, such as
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.17_0: a monastery, the site of a monastery, a dwelling, the site of a dwelling, a bed, a bench, a mattress, a pillow, a metal pot, a metal jar, a metal bucket, a metal bowl, a machete, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, a chisel, a creeper, bamboo, reed, grass, clay, wooden goods, earthenware goods—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.18_0: and uses them to win over and create a following among householders.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.19_0: This is the fourth great gangster to be found in the world.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.20_0: But in this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, this is the greatest gangster: one who untruthfully and groundlessly boasts about a superhuman quality.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.24_0: to be other than they really are,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.26_0: who enjoys what was gained by theft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.29_0: Being wicked, they are reborn in hell
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.31_0: It’d be better for the immoral and unrestrained
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.35_0: After rebuking the monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā in many ways for being difficult to maintain, difficult to support ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.36_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.37.1_0: ‘If a monk falsely claims for himself a superhuman quality, knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying, “This I know, this I see,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.38_0: but after some time—whether he is questioned or not, but having committed the offense and seeking purification—should say: “Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.38_1: What I said was empty and false:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.39_0: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.40_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
